title: Output-Oriented Management
summary: Focus on maximizing the output of your team or organization, not just activity or effort.

details.content: Prioritizing output ensures that resources and time are spent on activities that drive results, rather than just keeping busy.
Instead of tracking hours worked, a manager measures the number of completed projects that meet quality standards.

content: Define clear output metrics for your team.
Regularly review progress against these metrics.
Encourage team members to focus on end results, not just process.
Eliminate or delegate tasks that do not contribute to key outputs.

title: Decision-Making Processes
summary: Adopt structured approaches to making decisions efficiently and effectively.

details.content: Clear decision-making reduces confusion, speeds up execution, and increases accountability.
A team uses a decision matrix to evaluate and choose between competing project proposals.

content: Clarify who is responsible for making each decision.
Gather relevant data before deciding.
Encourage open discussion and dissent before finalizing decisions.
Document decisions and communicate them clearly.

title: Performance Measurement
summary: Implement systems to objectively measure and track performance at individual and team levels.

details.content: Measuring performance helps identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for improvement.
A manager sets quarterly goals and uses key performance indicators (KPIs) to track progress.

content: Define measurable goals for each role.
Review performance data regularly.
Provide feedback based on objective results.
Adjust goals and metrics as needed to stay aligned with business objectives.

title: Task Prioritization
summary: Systematically prioritize tasks to ensure the most important work gets done first.

details.content: Prioritization prevents wasted effort and ensures that critical objectives are met on time.
A manager uses the Eisenhower Matrix to distinguish between urgent and important tasks.

content: List all tasks and rank them by impact and urgency.
Delegate or defer low-priority tasks.
Review priorities daily or weekly.
Communicate priorities clearly to your team.

title: Effective Meetings
summary: Run meetings that are purposeful, time-efficient, and result in clear outcomes.

details.content: Well-run meetings save time, foster collaboration, and drive action.
A team leader sends an agenda before the meeting and ends with clear action items and owners.

content: Set a clear agenda and share it in advance.
Start and end meetings on time.
Assign roles (facilitator, note-taker, timekeeper).
Summarize decisions and next steps at the end.

title: Feedback and Coaching
summary: Provide regular, constructive feedback and coaching to help team members grow and improve.

details.content: Feedback and coaching drive continuous improvement and employee engagement.
A manager schedules monthly 1:1s to discuss progress, challenges, and development goals.

content: Give feedback promptly and specifically.
Balance positive and constructive feedback.
Set clear expectations for improvement.
Support team members with resources and guidance.

title: Managing Teams
summary: Lead teams by setting direction, building trust, and enabling collaboration.

details.content: Effective team management boosts morale, productivity, and innovation.
A manager holds regular team check-ins to align on goals and address obstacles together.

content: Set clear team goals and roles.
Foster open communication and psychological safety.
Recognize and celebrate team achievements.
Resolve conflicts quickly and fairly.
